Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.

Question: How to set a parameter in a HttpServletRequest?: :I am using a javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest to implement a web application.I have no problem to get the parameter of a request using the getParameter method. However I don't know how to set a parameter in my request.
Please using this api: Map.get.
Answer:<<<api>>>: HttpServletRequest.setAttribute
<<<code>>>: request.setAttribute("paramName", "paramValue");
<<<explanation>>>: The setAttribute() method of the HttpServletRequest interface sets an attribute in the request. This attribute may be retrieved by calling getAttribute() on this same request object.
Question: How to create a new thread in Java?:
Please using this api: Thread.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Thread
<<<code>>>: new Thread(() -> {
    // code to run in new thread
}).start();
<<<explanation>>>: To create a new thread in Java, you can use the Thread class. The constructor of the Thread class takes a Runnable object, which is the code that will be run in the new thread. The start() method is used to start the execution of the new thread.
Question: How to sort a list in Java?:
Please using this api: Collections.sort.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Collections.sort
<<<code>>>: Collections.sort(list);
<<<explanation>>>: The sort() method of the Collections class sorts the elements in the specified list into ascending order. The sort is performed using the natural ordering of its elements, or by a Comparator provided to the method.
Question: How to convert a List to an array?:
Please using this api: List.toArray.
Answer:<<<api>>>: List.toArray
<<<code>>>: Object[] array = list.toArray();
<<<explanation>>>: The toArray() method of the List interface returns an array containing all of the elements in this list in proper sequence (from first to last element). The returned array will be of type Object[], if the list is empty it will return an empty array.
Question: How to convert a String to a char array?:
Please using this api: String.toCharArray.
Answer:<<<api>>>: String.toCharArray
<<<code>>>: char[] charArray = string.toCharArray();
<<<explanation>>>: The toCharArray() method of the String class returns a new character array whose length is the length of this string and whose contents are the characters in the string.
Question: How to convert a char array to a String?:
Please using this api: String.valueOf.
Answer:<<<api>>>: String.valueOf
<<<code>>>: String string = String.valueOf(charArray);
<<<explanation>>>: The valueOf() method of the String class returns the string object representing the specified array of characters.
Question: How to convert a String to an int in Java?:
Please using this api: Integer.parseInt.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Integer.parseInt
<<<code>>>: int i = Integer.parseInt(string);
<<<explanation>>>: The parseInt() method of the Integer class wraps a primitive int into an object of class Integer. The string argument is parsed as a signed decimal integer.
Question: How to convert an int to a String in Java?:
Please using this api: String.valueOf.
Answer:<<<api>>>: String.valueOf
<<<code>>>: String string = String.valueOf(i);
<<<explanation>>>: The valueOf() method of the String class returns the string object representing the specified integer.
Question: How to convert a String to a double in Java?:
Please using this api: Double.parseDouble.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Double.parseDouble
<<<code>>>: double d = Double.parseDouble(string);
<<<explanation>>>: The parseDouble() method of the Double class wraps a primitive double into an object of class Double. The string argument is parsed as a double.
Question: How to convert a double to a String in Java?:
Please using this api: String.valueOf.
Answer:<<<api>>>: String.valueOf
<<<code>>>: String string = String.valueOf(d);
<<<explanation>>>: The valueOf() method of the String class returns the string object representing the specified double.
